001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.OutputStream;
005import java.io.OutputStreamWriter;
006
007import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheConfig;
008import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheFlags;
009import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheType;
010
011/**
012 * A JStachio Template is a renderer that has template meta data.
013 * <p>
014 * Generated code implements this interface.
015 * <p>
016 * While many of the methods allow passing in custom Escapers care must be taken to choose
017 * a proper escaper that supports the original media type and charset of the template.
018 * There is currently no runtime checking that the escaper supports the template's media
019 * type and charset.
020 *
021 * @author agentgt
022 * @param <T> the model type
023 */
024public interface Template<T> extends Renderer<T>, TemplateInfo {
025
026        /**
027         * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream using the
028         * {@link #templateCharset()} for encoding. If the template is pre-encoded the
029         * pre-encoded parts of the template will be written to the stream for performance
030         * otherwise an unbuffered {@link OutputStreamWriter} will be used.
031         * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
032         * @param outputStream to write to.
033         * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
034         * @apiNote The stream will not be closed but might be flushed by this call.
035         * @see EncodedTemplate
036         */
037        default void write(T model, //
038                        OutputStream outputStream) throws IOException {
039                OutputStreamWriter ow = new OutputStreamWriter(outputStream, templateCharset());
040                execute(model, ow);
041                ow.flush();
042        }
043
044        /**
045         * <strong>EXPERIMENTAL</strong> support of pre-encoded templates that have the static
046         * parts of the template already encoded into bytes. By default all
047         * {@link JStacheType#JSTACHIO} templates that are generated are of this type. To
048         * disable see {@link JStacheFlags.Flag#PRE_ENCODE_DISABLE}.
049         * <p>
050         * This interface is to support
051         * <a href="https://github.com/fizzed/rocker#near-zero-copy-rendering"> Rocker style
052         * near zero-copy rendering</a> where the static template parts are stored as byte
053         * arrays.
054         * <p>
055         * The passed in {@link OutputStream} <em>will only have
056         * {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])} called</em> thus an array or list of byte arrays
057         * can be accumulated to support almost zero-copy. <strong> Consequently absolutely no
058         * mutation of the byte arrays should happen as they could be reusable static parts of
059         * the template! </strong>
060         * <p>
061         * <em>Overall it is recommended that you do not use this interface unless you have an
062         * intimate knowledge of how your platform buffers data and have byte like access as
063         * current JMH benchmarking indicates that
064         * {@link String#getBytes(java.nio.charset.Charset)} is generally much faster for raw
065         * byte conversion albeit at the possible cost of increased memory. One should peform
066         * their own benchmarking to confirm using this interface is worth it. </em>
067         *
068         * @author agentgt
069         * @param <T> the model type
070         * @apiNote The passed in {@link OutputStream} <em>will only have
071         * {@link OutputStream#write(byte[])} called</em> and no mutation of the passed in
072         * byte array should happen downstream.
073         * @see JStacheFlags.Flag#PRE_ENCODE_DISABLE
074         */
075        public interface EncodedTemplate<T> extends Template<T> {
076
077                /**
078                 * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream leveraging pre-encoded
079                 * parts of the template. This <em>may</em> improve performance when rendering
080                 * UTF-8 to an OutputStream as some of the encoding is done in advance. Because
081                 * the encoding is done statically you cannot pass the charset in. The chosen
082                 * charset comes from {@link JStacheConfig#charset()}.
083                 * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
084                 * @param outputStream to write to.
085                 * @throws IOException if an error occurs while writing to the outputStream
086                 * @apiNote The stream will not be closed or flushed by this call.
087                 */
088                @Override
089                default void write(T model, //
090                                OutputStream outputStream) throws IOException {
091                        write(model, Output.of(outputStream, templateCharset()));
092                }
093
094                /**
095                 * Renders the passed in model directly to a binary stream leveraging pre-encoded
096                 * parts of the template. This <em>may</em> improve performance when rendering
097                 * UTF-8 to an OutputStream as some of the encoding is done in advance. Because
098                 * the encoding is done statically you cannot pass the charset in. The chosen
099                 * charset comes from {@link JStacheConfig#charset()}.
100                 * @param <A> output type
101                 * @param <E> error type
102                 * @param model a model assumed never to be <code>null</code>.
103                 * @param output to write to.
104                 * @throws E if an error occurs while writing to output
105                 */
106                public <A extends io.jstach.jstachio.Output.EncodedOutput<E>, E extends Exception> void write( //
107                                T model, //
108                                A output) throws E;
109
110        }
111
112}
